term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - electron stopping power in X-ray emission spectroscopy
term.title: electron stopping power

item.text: When a beam of electrons strikes a target or specimen there are three ways in which the electrons may lose energy (low energy collisions, X-ray production, and formation of a spectral continuum). The average energy loss per unit distance travelled along the electron path is called electron stopping power, dE/dx.
